@ICON[header] GM NOTES

  • Discuss with the Predator’s player what story their curse contributes to, and make sure that it’s something that your table can work with. Keep the safety tools handy and balance their arc with the rest of the party. [Might roll this advice into an iconic character.]

  • While it might not be the main focus, their story is likely to include themes of limiting and taking responsibility for the harm that we cause to others. Give them opportunities to resist or give in to temptation, and see how the rest of the party responds.

  • Fabula Ultima is not a game about smashing all who oppose you... but now and again it’s fun to be a Halloween monster and terrorize a crowd that really deserves it. Things don’t have to be bleak all the time!

  • Some people will be terrified of the Predator, while others will be unimpressed. Of the latter, some will be deluded and others rightfully confident. Be sure to include a mix of reactions. Characters may even find them fascinating, pitiable, or cute!

  • Children of the Night allows the Predator to commune with bats, wolves, leeches, armadillos, and other spooky creatures. Like the Chimerist’s Feral Speech (Core), this creates more ways to get information and scene-setting to the players.

  • At character creation, it may be easier to represent this condition with a Quirk, offered on Page XX, because it offers an off-ramp without having to majorly rebuild a character. But maybe you don’t want an off-ramp…

@ICON[header] ADAPTATION

  • The simplest way to change this class is to modify the Species that Dark Hunger applies to, and possibly the status effect that Spreading Terror looks for (which would also change the effect that you are not allowed to take for Dark Hunger.)

    • Example: the Volt Thief - in a construct-heavy game, this is an ancient android that saps energy and computing power from other machines. They hack into constructs for MP by inflicting dazed, and gain strength when there are slowed constructs on the scene.

  • This Class doesn’t have abilities that drain foes by hitting them because Darkblade (Core), Chimerist (Core), and Mutant (Techno) all have that territory covered. Consider adding one of them to get the feel of a more aggressive Predator.

  • Speaking of the Mutant - if you’re playing with Techno Fantasy classes, you could replace the Wolfman’s Rogue Skills with Mutant, taking Akromorphosis and Theriomorphosis (Dynamotheria, Tachytheria). This would save money on weapons and give you a thematic transformation!

  • If you have multiple Predators and their condition is going to be a major theme for your game... first, consider if you want to be playing something by White Wolf instead. If not, take a look at the optional extra Bond rules (in an upcoming Horror supplement). Just remember: the strength of a Bond never goes above 3, even if you’re using these!
